content.description: This fun little climb starts on the short arete facing the bankside opposite of the guest trail.  Sit start compressed with the right hand on a low side pull and left hand on a smaller side pull under the steep belly.  Get some feet established and make a couple of moves to top out straight up.  7/29/21

Start just left of "Made" under the steep belly.  Left hand starts on the left arete down low and right hand on a small edge in a vertical seam.  Giver er’ a good squeeze to get to the in-cut crimp above, leading way to a nice jug.  Move up and left to top out at the highest point.  7/29/21

There is a small roof on the downstream side of the boulder.  Start compressed under the nose of the boulder.  Left hand on a rail up higher and the right hand pinching on the bottom edge of the boulder.  Crank down a right heel to bump to a side-pull out right and make a move up to a good jug with the left.  Move up and right towards the middle of the boulder.  Top out just before making it to the point.
This boulder is just past the ‘Hell Boulder’ near the river bank opposite of the Guest Trail. Low water conditions are necessary to access/climb on this boulder. Great stone in a beautiful location.
